oai_dc:dc.dc:title: POSSIBLE OVERDOPING IN TLSRLACUO5 AND SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN TLBALACUO5 BY ISOVALENT-CATION SUBSTITUTION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUNDARESAN, A
NAGARAJAN, R
GUPTA, LC
VIJAYARAGHAVAN, R
SHARON, M
TAMHANE, AS
PINTO, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cu-o system
crystal-chemistry
tl
single
temperature
transition
oxides
holes
state
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It is known that superconductivity in TlSrLaCuO5 is due to the overlap of empty Tl 6s band with the antibonding Cu 3d(x2-y2) band at the Fermi level. This motivated us to investigate the effects of isovalent-cation substitution in superconducting TlSrLaCuO5 and semiconducting TlBaLaCuO5. We have succeeded in inducing superconductivity in TIBaLaCuO5 by introducing Ca2+ at the Ba sites.
